header.title: Luciferian Sorcery and Set-Typhon
header.category: Western Esotericism, Occultism, Luciferianism, Setianism, Witchcraft, Chaos Magick

central_thesis: This article defines and elaborates on Luciferian Gnosis and Luciferian Witchcraft as an antinomian Left Hand Path, rooted in ancient adversarial deities like Set-Typhon. It posits a system of self-deification, transformation, and individual will-manifestation, integrating elements from Egyptian mythology, Chaos Magick, and various occult traditions.

structure_content.chapter_title: Suti (Set) and the Devil-forms of ancient Egypt
structure_content.summary: Explores Set's role as the Adversary in Luciferian Gnosis, linking him to the crocodile-god Sebak and Typhon. It details Set's various forms, his dominion over darkness, storms, and the underworld (Tuat), and his association with Seker and Apep. Set's 'Adversarial' nature is presented as existing both in the underworld and as a Man-God on earth, embodying Anti-Nature and pursuing its own course.

structure_content.chapter_title: Names and Attributes of the Adversary
structure_content.summary: Lists numerous names for the Adversary (Set and Apophis) in ancient Egypt, including Nak, Sabau, Apep, Suti, Baba, Smy, and others. It describes 'The Smaiu and Mesu Betshet' as 'Children of Rebellion' who were shape-shifters venerating the Serpent. The material associated with Set-Typhon is iron ('the bone of Typho'), representing his strength, dominion, and role as personification of dark waters and the desert, acting as a tester and sorcerous initiator.

structure_content.chapter_title: Predators of the Spirit and Tuat Entities
structure_content.summary: Discusses Apep (Apophis) as the Demon Serpent of chaos, often battled by Set and later merged into him, taking the form of a crocodile. Set is also identified as a God of Death. The Tuat contains demon-serpents like 'Sati-temui' and 'Akriu', and a Lord in serpent form with the 'Evil Eye', highlighting Set's creative, progressive, and shape-shifting nature for survival.

Positions Luciferian Witchcraft as a refined development of primal sorcery, a Sethian concept of the Adversary as a dual and necessary force, leading to self-transformation. It serves as a gateway to gnosis of Satan, rooted in adversarial traits from various cultures including Ahriman and Set/Sutekh. The Luciferian Path, as a multicultural force, prepares the mind and body to embody the Adversary's essence, shaping chaos into self-willed order, which by definition is Chaos Magick utilized for personal growth and initiation.

structure_content.chapter_title: The Witches' Sabbat and its Meaning
structure_content.summary: Explains the Witches' Sabbat as having Celestial (Light, Fire, divinity) and Infernal (daemonic) aspects, representing a spiritual transference from waking life to astral/dream rites. It explores its historical context and links it to Austin Osman Spare's concept of the Sabbat as a healthy practice for spiritual and physical vigor, fostering the gathering of spirits.

Introduces 'AZOTHOZ' as a symbolic entry into Luciferian practice, a cipher (poem and prose) for ensorcelling the self and achieving spiritual awareness through a 'Luciferian and Sethian mirror'. It connects self-initiation to the lore of the Watchers, Nephilim, Black Eagle, and the Adversary, culminating in a Luciferian process of Self-Liberation that unifies Daemon and Angel outside Christian frameworks, bringing order to the self through Set's spirit.

structure_content.chapter_title: Key God Forms and Concepts in Luciferian Sorcery
structure_content.summary: Provides detailed definitions of crucial entities and concepts: Apep (serpent-demon of chaos, Set's primal aspect), Anubis (Lord of Jackals, tester, Mortuary God, mask for necromancy), Alphabet of Desire (tool for self-determination, communication with familiars, rooted in Qlippoth), The 8-Pointed Luciferian Star/ALGOL (Chaos Star representing void, order from chaos, Ahriman's Five Elements), Holy Guardian Angel/Evil Genius (projected imagination, blend of demonic and angelic forces), Fetishes (power storehouses, extensions of self for 'predatory spirituality'), Cain (Lord of Horsemen, Luciferian Patron, earth form of Set), Leviathan (primal Goddess, unity of sexualities, encircler of path), Shaitan/Lucifer (Bringer of Light, Fallen Angel, rebel for knowledge, embodying darkness and light), Lilith-Az-Babalon-Hecate (Daemonic Feminine, Witch Queen, source of power and self-deification).

Discusses the influence of Charles Pace (Hamar'at), a Priest of Set and Anubis in the 1960s, on Luciferian Witchcraft. Pace's Sethanic Cult of Masks and manuscripts ('NECROMINION', 'THE BOOK OF TAHUTI') contained sexual magick rites ('ANKH-KA'), the Five Fold Kiss, and a unique Hermetic Tarot. His ANKH KA DJED concept (triple form, self-invigoration) is integrated into Ford's work, providing a clear lineage for the Luciferian Gnosis and Sethian self-evolution.

Reiterates that the Luciferian Essence is intertwined with the Sethian current, serving as a tool for self-deification and advancement. It emphasizes a firm and serious approach to Chaos Magick, with Set emerging as the 'Bearer of the Black Flame', signaling a challenging, potent new form of Witchcraft returning to Primal Sorcery with a Sethian, Ahrimanic, or Luciferian spirit.

key_concepts.definition: The developing understanding of the Adversary as a foundational force, leading to a path of self-transformation and antinomian practice, primarily through identification with figures like Set-Typhon.

An early, multicultural form of spirit (e.g., Set, Sebak, Apep, Typhon) that pre-exists human consciousness, embodying Anti-Nature, acting against natural laws to forge its own course, and serving as a tester and sorcerous initiator.

An antinomian Left Hand Path practice focused on self-deification, self-transformation, and the manifestation of will through identification with adversarial forces. It utilizes primal sorcery and chaotic forces to forge individual order and power.

An ancient Egyptian deity syncretized with the Greek Typhon, considered an early embodiment of the Adversary. Associated with storms, darkness, chaos, war, and shape-shifting (e.g., crocodile). His nature is Anti-Nature, forging his own course.

The serpent-demon of chaos and abyssal waters, an early embodiment of Sumerian Tiamat. Initially an adversary to Set, Apep was later conquered, mastered, and merged into Set, representing Set's primal draconian aspect of self.

A methodology within Luciferian Witchcraft that utilizes chaotic forces to establish temporary Order within the self, serving as a tool for initiatory focus and personal growth rather than simple paradigm shifting.

A mystical process of spiritual transference from waking flesh to an astral/dream rite, embodying both Celestial (Light, Fire, divinity) and Infernal (daemonic) aspects, fostering the gathering of spirits and personal vigor.

Known as CHIVA or Chioa, 'the Beast', offspring of Samael and Lilith. He is the Lord of the Horsemen, the Luciferian Patron, and initiator of the path. Cain is considered an earthly form of Set, representing awakening and the lore of the Sorcerous Blacksmith.

A symbolic entry point into Luciferian practice, presented as a cipher in poem and prose. It details the process of ensorcelling the self and self-initiation through the lore of the Watchers, Nephilim, Black Eagle, and the essence of the Adversary, leading to Self-Liberation and the union of Daemon and Angel.

Within Luciferian Sorcery, these are not separate entities but the projected and developed imagination of the Sorcerer. They represent the blend of demonic (lower, bestial, atavistic) and angelic (higher, empyrean) forces within the self, illuminated and empowered by one's own desires.

Storehouses of power, representing aspects of the sorcerer's personality. They serve as gateways of consciousness and extensions of the self, created with elements suitable for a desired purpose, and are central to 'Predatory spirituality'.

The Lord of Jackals and Opener of the Way, analogous to Hermes, the gateway unto Death. Anubis acts as a tester, a Mortuary God, and his mask is undertaken in Luciferian Sorcery for necromantic experiments and exploring the realms of the dead.

A formulaic point of congress with 'otherness', an unspeakable grammar. It is a tool for self-determination, achieving goals, and a means of communication with the sorcerer's familiars (HGA, Evil Genius), rooted in the 22 Tunnels of the Qlippoth.

Also called the Chaos Star/Sigil, it symbolizes the void, non-being, and chaos from which the Black Adept weaves temporary Order. It is connected to the ritual of transferring consciousness, representing Dingir (God, Heaven, Star), and the Five Elements of Ahriman.

The Daemonic Feminine, identified as the fountain of the Witch Cult. She is the Succubus Witch Queen of the Sabbat, the 'mother of us all', and a well of power for self-deification. Individuals are encouraged to invoke her within, regardless of gender.
A concept from Charles Pace, meaning a 'triple form and self-invigoration'. It presents a result similar to the Bornless One Ritual, designed to activate and empower the self.

practical_system.description: The practical system, Luciferian Witchcraft, is an operative Left Hand Path focused on self-deification, self-transformation, and the manifestation of will through conscious identification with adversarial forces. It utilizes primal sorcery and chaotic energies to forge individual order and power, moving beyond conventional 'good' or 'evil' definitions to embrace a holistic understanding of the self's shadow and light aspects. The aim is to become 'like' Set or Ahriman, achieving a potent spiritual articulation and self-liberation.
tools: The Alphabet of Desire: An 'unspeakable grammar' for congress with the subconscious and familiars, used for self-determination and achieving goals, based on the 22 Tunnels of the Qlippoth.
Fetishes: Consecrated objects (e.g., human skull with sigil, grave soil) serving as storehouses of power, gateways of consciousness, and extensions of the sorcerer's personality.
Masks of deities: Employing the 'mask' of entities like Anubis or Set for identification and to embody their attributes.
Sigils: Graphical representations such as the Sigil of Hecate (mirror into the Gates of the Dead) and the 8-Pointed Luciferian Star (Chaos Star/Sigil) for focusing will and embodying concepts.
Grimoires and texts: 'Luciferian Witchcraft', 'Liber HVHI', 'Book of the Witch Moon', 'AZOTHOZ', 'NECROMINION', and 'THE BOOK OF TAHUTI' serve as foundational texts and practical guides.
Hermetic Tarot: Utilized, specifically the version with differing attributes from Aleister Crowley's Thoth deck, as presented in 'THE BOOK OF TAHUTI'.
rituals: Self-initiation through study and identification with the lore of the Watchers and Nephilim.
Sabbat rites: Spiritual transference from waking consciousness to astral/dream rites for gathering of spirits and self-exploration.
Atavistic workings (e.g., drawing from the 'Bornless One Ritual') to call forth and integrate the Evil Genius and Holy Guardian Angel.
Necromantic experiments, including undertaking the mask of Anubis to interact with shades of the dead.
ANKH KA DJED: A triple form for self-invigoration and activation, similar to the Bornless One Ritual.
Sexual Magick rite 'ANKH-KA' and the Five Fold Kiss, as described in 'NECROMINION' and Sethanic Cult of Masks.

relevant_quotes.text: “I am the Crocodile-god (Sebak) who dwelleth amid his terrors. I am the Crocodile-god and I seize (my prey) like a ravening beast" – “Transformation into the Crocodile-god” from “The Egyptian Book of the Dead"

“Luciferian Witchcraft" presents a gateway to gnosis of what our culture has called Satan, specifically reaching into the roots of the adversary to discover the various cultural traits of the Luciferian spirit.
The Sabbat itself stands between normal dreaming and waking, it is a mystical process undermined by determination to change and progress.
There is no mystical guideline for this force, it is very much a part of your being, illuminated and empowered by your own desires.

critical_analysis.relevance: The text is highly relevant for understanding a specific, syncretic branch of modern occultism, specifically Michael W. Ford's interpretation of Luciferianism. It meticulously frames Luciferian Witchcraft as a robust, operative Left Hand Path system for self-deification, drawing rich connections between ancient Egyptian adversarial deities (Set-Typhon, Apep, Anubis) and broader Western esoteric concepts (Chaos Magick, Qabalah's Qlippoth, Witches' Sabbat, HGA/Evil Genius). It solidifies a theoretical and practical framework for antinomian magical practice, emphasizing personal transformation and the manifestation of will, distinguishing itself from more sterile or dogmatic approaches.
critical_analysis.target_audience: The target audience includes practitioners of Luciferianism and the Left Hand Path, serious students of contemporary occultism and witchcraft, Chaos Magicians seeking a structured adversarial gnosis, researchers interested in the modern syncretism of ancient mythologies with Western esoteric traditions, and those exploring the works of Michael W. Ford and related authors like Austin Osman Spare and Charles Pace.
